00131 {
00132     virtual HRESULT __stdcall Link_To_Object(void* pointer) = 0; //Links object to locomotor.
00133         virtual bool __stdcall Is_Moving() = 0; //Sees if object is moving.
00134     virtual CoordStruct* __stdcall Destination(CoordStruct* pcoord) = 0;        //Fetches destination coordinate.
00135     virtual CoordStruct* __stdcall Head_To_Coord(CoordStruct* pcoord) = 0; // Fetches immediate (next cell) destination coordinate.
00136     virtual eMove __stdcall Can_Enter_Cell(CellStruct cell) = 0; //Determine if specific cell can be entered.
00137     virtual bool __stdcall Is_To_Have_Shadow() = 0;     //Should object cast a shadow?
00138     virtual Matrix3DStruct* __stdcall Draw_Matrix(Matrix3DStruct* pMatrix, int* key) = 0; //Fetch voxel draw matrix.
00139     virtual Matrix3DStruct* __stdcall Shadow_Matrix(Matrix3DStruct* pMatrix, int* key) = 0;     //Fetch shadow draw matrix.
00140     virtual Point2D* __stdcall Draw_Point(Point2D* pPoint) = 0; //Draw point center location.
00141     virtual Point2D* __stdcall Shadow_Point(Point2D* pPoint) = 0;       //Shadow draw point center location.
00142     virtual eVisualType __stdcall Visual_Character(VARIANT_BOOL flag) = 0;      //Visual character for drawing.
00143     virtual int __stdcall Z_Adjust() = 0;       //Z adjust control value.
00144     virtual eZGradient __stdcall Z_Gradient() = 0;      //Z gradient control value.
00145     virtual bool __stdcall Process() = 0;       //Process movement of object.]
00146     virtual void __stdcall Move_To(CoordStruct to) = 0; //Instruct to move to location specified.
00147     virtual void __stdcall Stop_Moving() = 0;   //Stop moving at first opportunity.
00148     virtual void __stdcall Do_Turn(DirStruct coord) = 0;        //Try to face direction specified.
00149     virtual void __stdcall Unlimbo() = 0;       //Object is appearing in the world.
00150     virtual void __stdcall Tilt_Pitch_AI() = 0; //Special tilting AI function.
00151     virtual bool __stdcall Power_On() = 0;      //Locomotor becomes powered.
00152     virtual bool __stdcall Power_Off() = 0;     //Locomotor loses power.
00153     virtual bool __stdcall Is_Powered() = 0;    //Is locomotor powered?
00154     virtual bool __stdcall Is_Ion_Sensitive() = 0;      //Is locomotor sensitive to ion storms?
00155     virtual bool __stdcall Push(DirStruct dir) = 0;     //Push object in direction specified.
00156     virtual bool __stdcall Shove(DirStruct dir) = 0;    //Shove object (with spin) in direction specified.
00157     virtual void __stdcall Force_Track(int track, CoordStruct coord) = 0;       //Force drive track -- special case only.
00158     virtual eLayer __stdcall In_Which_Layer() = 0;      //What display layer is it located in.
00159     virtual void __stdcall Force_Immediate_Destination(CoordStruct coord) = 0;  //Don't use this function.
00160     virtual void __stdcall Force_New_Slope(int ramp) = 0;       //Force a voxel unit to a given slope. Used in cratering.
00161     virtual bool __stdcall Is_Moving_Now() = 0; //Is it actually moving across the ground this very second?
00162     virtual int __stdcall Apparent_Speed() = 0; //Actual current speed of object expressed as leptons per game frame.
00163     virtual int __stdcall Drawing_Code() = 0;   //Special drawing feedback code (locomotor specific meaning)
00164     virtual FireError __stdcall Can_Fire() = 0; //Queries if any locomotor specific state prevents the object from firing.
00165     virtual int __stdcall Get_Status() = 0;     //Queries the general state of the locomotor.
00166     virtual void __stdcall Acquire_Hunter_Seeker_Target() = 0;  //Forces a hunter seeker droid to find a target.
00167     virtual bool __stdcall Is_Surfacing() = 0;  //Is this object surfacing?

00169     virtual bool __stdcall Is_Moving_Here(CoordStruct to) = 0;  //Is this object in the process of moving into this coord.
00170     virtual bool __stdcall Will_Jump_Tracks() = 0;      //Will this object jump tracks?

00174     virtual void __stdcall Unlock() = 0;        //Unlocks the locomotor from being deleted

00182 {
00183     virtual HRESULT __stdcall Begin_Piggyback(ILocomotion* pointer) = 0;        //Piggybacks a locomotor onto this one.
00184     virtual HRESULT __stdcall End_Piggyback(ILocomotion** pointer) = 0; //End piggyback process and restore locomotor interface pointer.

00188 };
